content:
If I remember correctly from the last dev meeting (I'm in a bit of a fog this week), we're going to try and push a bug-fix release on Sunday afternoon. Just mentioning this in case anyone was unaware and wants to try and get any bug fixes done.

Are there any particular bug fixes that need testing (or that folks really want to be tested)? I'll try to spend a little time getting ready for the release tomorrow.

...I would like to get https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4732 in. We have 3 different/alternative PRs (filed by yours truly - sorry :sweat_smile: ) ...they all solve the problem, but not sure which approach is the best :shrug: ...I'll wait for @indigoxela and @BWPanda to have another look when they are up/available, but perhaps also our other core committers like @Herb or @quicksketch can chime in.

Description of the bug When adding a Number (integer) field to a layout, the layout page produces errors: Steps To Reproduce To reproduce the behavior: Add a Number (integer) field to a content typ...
I'm happy with PR3

@BWPanda I've closed the 1st PR, but I think that we should merge the 2nd and 3rd PR code changes into one, and that that should be the final solution. Please see my last couple of comments in the issue when you get a chance.

I've merged all RTBC issues, except for https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4111 which I personally marked RTBC just the other day. So another core committers eyes on that would be appreciated please.

When installing Backdrop using ./core/scripts/install.sh I see lots of the following warnings: PHP Warning: ini_set(): Headers already sent. You cannot change the session module's ini settings ...

Here's one that I'd like to get into the next release: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4640

Two people already reviewed/commented, all requested changes have been applied, but the final review is missing.

THanks for the prompt @indigoxela. Just request a comment wording change.
@BWPanda Many thanks for having a look, comment has been updated.

Hi folks! I will need to push back my starting time for the 1.17.2 release to 1pm PT (about 1.5 hours from now). But I'm excited to get our progress out! Thanks @BWPanda for getting the RTBC queue nearly cleared out!
I can do the Tugboat release stuff if you like. In about 5 hrs.
@BWPanda Thanks that would be great. :D
I'm going to look at the remaining RTBC issues and run through our agenda issues to see if there's any last things for 1.17.2.

Last chance if anyone has any objections to MySQL 8 support: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4238

MySQL 8 support · Issue #4238 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need MySQL 8 has a number of incompatibilities with previous versions, including new keywords that need to be escaped, and removing of the NO_AUTO_CREATE_USER init SQL mode. This...
I'm available to help as needed.
I'm also running later than expected, but here for a while.
I am all set up. What can I do to help?

Hi @StPaulTim! Great to have your help. We don't yet have a 1.17.2 release issue. Could you copy it from https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/blob/master/procedures/issue-template--release--bug-fix.md ?

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
Maybe. I'm having some connection issues.
Busy trying to send photo of me sitting by lake working on release, but connection is not strong enough.

At this point we've got in all the RTBC issues, the MySQL 8 issue, and I'm going through the "Works for me" issues that also are "Needs review". We could cut off and make the release at any point now.

I looking forward tothis getting in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4073 :wink:

Is that a multi-storey keyboard? :smiling_face:
Ah, my photo finally went through. I tried to send this about 7 times, so hopefully they don't all come through eventually.
Yes, I have a very sophisticated keyboard setup. My original keyboard is toast, so I carry around a bluetooth keyboard and set it on top of the original keyboard.
Hoping to get a new computer soon. Planning on Linux machine, but getting nervous about that.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4742

Backdrop 1.17.2 Release checklist · Issue #4742 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for Nov 8th, 2020 3pm - 6pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Create the next bugfix milestone @jenlampton Move all unfinished issues to the next bugfix release mile...

@StPaulTim Don't be nervous about Linux! :smiling_face: It depends what you do on your computer as to what OS is best for you. My Aunty is no kind of computer expert, but I've had her using Linux for years now as she only does internet, emails and word processing. Obviously if you're into online gaming or photo/video production, etc. then you'll need to research more carefully if Linux will work for you.

@BWPanda what distribution do you prefer? I’ve been experimenting with putting Linux on a mini HP i have around. Ubuntu worked ok, but some variety of RHEL seems to be jive with enterprise gigs. I’m not looking to pay licensing, which leads me to centOS. But there’s a bewildering variety of other options.
(I ran lots of Linux as home systems since 1994; ran my own mail servers until 2004. )
Do any of them have GUIs for Vhosts and such? Everybody knows by now how I dislike editing config files :smirk:

@BWPanda I think if we make one change to the module_set_weight() PR we can get that one in. Can you check out https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4073#issuecomment-723678944 ?

Do we need to run update script on this release?
I'll check...
@StPaulTim No update.php needed and no .htaccess changes.
OK, I'm drafting in WIKI so that we dont' have formatting problems. Not sure how else to draft them, because I can't open a new tag.
Last time I drafted in Google docs and that wasn't good.
Yeah I usually post it as a comment on the issue, then you can toggle back and forth between the "Preview" tab if needed.
I'm able to do the same in the wiki, but a comment is also good.
@quicksketch PR updated for that issue.

@quicksketch - I followed the 1.16.1 release format. I listed every PR by title.
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.16.3

I'm double checking now, but you can look.

@StPaulTim Looks good! Perhaps we should clarify "Remove 'Spock' from Backdrop." lol, that's just a confusing title. I squeezed in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4073 as the last issue to be merged.

I thought about that. ;-)

But, I like having a Spock issue in core for future trivia night.
I'll clarify it.
@quicksketch Done
Super duper! Okay let's kick off the release :smile:
I love these releases where it's just one version and no need for security coordination.

Release is out https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.2

About to tweet
@quicksketch - I don't know if you noticed, but issues in release notes were listed newest to oldest, but I put MYSQL 8 issue at the top, because I thought it might be the most important.

Will have lunch, put my daughter down for a nap, then come and update Tugboat demos with new core release.
It's all good @StPaulTim. Agreed I sometimes do some rearrangement in the release notes but don't sweat it.
Dang. That's a lot of changes for a maintenance release.

@quicksketch If you're still around, I accidentally made Tugboat's new tag with dots instead of dashes: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos/releases Do you think that matters? Should I redo it?

Releases · backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos
Backdrop CMS demo sites powered by Tugboat. Contribute to backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos development by creating an account on GitHub.
Seems to work ok, so will leave it for now unless I hear back from you. Can always fix later if needbe I guess.
@BWPanda I don't think it matters. I did dashes because the tag ends up in the URLs, but turns out Tugboat automatically converts dots so it didn't matter.
@BWPanda Not sure if you're done yet but my 1.17.2 demo sandbox seems to have failed: https://backdropcms.org/demo/5fa8a00a3ffc7f72f6bf7576

Hmmm, log says:

2020-11-09T01:49:08.110Z - 5fa8a00b3ffc7f2c4bbf75c3# git -C /var/lib/tugboat fetch origin tags/1.17.2
From github.com:backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos
 * tag               1.17.2     -> FETCH_HEAD
2020-11-09T01:49:08.631Z - 5fa8a00b3ffc7f2c4bbf75c3# git -C /var/lib/tugboat checkout tags/1.17.2
error: pathspec 'tags/1.17.2' did not match any file(s) known to git
2020-11-09T01:49:09.568Z - Command Failed (Tugboat Error 1064): Exit code (1)

It obviously exists though: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos/releases/tag/1.17.2

Release 1.17.2 · backdrop-ops/tugboat-demos
Update to Backdrop 1.17.2.
Not sure what I did wrong :frown: Are you able to help @quicksketch ?
@BWPanda Oh I know what this is. Apparently our sandboxes are not sending the proper tag request, so the default base preview gets used. This is my sandbox in the Tugboat dashboard: image.png
See how it built from 1-17-1 even though it supposedly was trying to build tag 1.17.2? Our API requests are apparently not specifying the base preview ID.
So the trick for the time being is to remove 1-17-1 as a base preview entirely, then the only base preview remaining (1.17.2) will be used as the base.
Won't that mean all 1-17-1 demos will grow to full-size?

No, apparently any preview can be used as a base preview. So I'm not deleting the 1-17-1 base preview, just unmarking it as an "official" base preview. There's a terminology problem there. Every preview can be used as a base. The "Base Previews" section in the tugboat dashboard really should be called "Automatic Base Previews" or something.
Ah ok
I think we may need another setting in the Tugboat module for "Base Preview ID" or something. Though that's kind of annoying that we would need to both ask for "Git Ref" and "Base Preview ID".
Indeed
Or maybe we just update the release instructions to say "delete the base preview from two version ago, and unmark the last version as a base preview"...?
So then we only ever have one base preview in that repo.
Yeah there we go. Unmarking 1-17-1 preview as a base preview has fixed them. Latest test sandbox is https://backdropcms.org/demo/5fa8a3b62dbb90b92e5375f2 and it works fine now.
Last release, I filed an issue with the Tugboat team saying this behavior was "broken" and they responded back saying that "you're doing it wrong". The base preview thing is incredibly confusing.
Yeah. The API docs mention "anchored Base Previews", so maybe that's what they mean by the ones listed seperately from the rest
Well thanks for finding and fixing the problem @quicksketch !
I updated the release instructions so I know for next time what to do.

It will not be necessary to run the update script

It IS necessary because of translation_update_1001() (Fix Views which still have the Drupal 7 version...), so the release comment should be updated.
Updated.
Thanks @indigoxela! I installed Backdrop 1.17.1 and then updated to 1.17.2. But I didn't enable Translation module. Nice catch.

The links to the respective issues in the release description also need to be fixed, as they currently 404 ...they are in the form of https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/blob/1.17.2/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/1604 when they should be https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4638

The links to the respective issues in the release description also need to be fixed

Sorry about that. I tested them all when they were still in the comment section of the release issue. But, clearly the links are relative and not working on the actual release page.
